meanings.definition: The result or product of growth or development, especially of plants or trees.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree bore delicious fruitage this year.
meanings.sent2: The farmer proudly displayed the fruitage of his hard work at the market.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole some of the fruitage from the orchard.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her studies bore fruitage in the form of excellent grades.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with colorful and bountiful fruitage.

meanings.definition: The yield or profit produced by labor or investment.
meanings.sent1: The business venture resulted in a significant financial fruitage.
meanings.sent2: Investors eagerly awaited the quarterly fruitage report.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected success of the project brought a pleasant fruitage.
meanings.sent4: His wise investments bore fruitage beyond his expectations.
meanings.sent5: The company's hard work finally yielded fruitage in the form of a successful product launch.
